Class ASTNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • ASTNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<ASTNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Assmt, Const, Expr, Factor, Ident, Oprn, Term

    public abstract class ASTNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<ASTNode>
    The parent abstract class of all types of abstract syntax tree (AST) nodes. Constructors and methods of ASTNode permit an ASTNode to have any number of ASTNode children.

    In addition to the instance methods shown here, a class X extending ASTNode abstract class must provide a static factory method with this signature: 

    public static X parse(java.lang.String s)
    This method will parse the given String according to the rules for the nonterminal symbol represented by class X, and return an instance of class X which is the root of an abstract syntax (sub)tree rooted at that instance that corresponds to the parse of the String; or null if such a parse is not possible.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        protected void addChild(ASTNode n)
        Append an ASTNode to the list of children of this ASTNode.
        PRECONDITION: n is a non-null ASTNode
        POSTCONDITION: n has been appended to the list of children of this ASTNode.
        Parameters:
        n - the ASTNode to append to the list of children of this ASTNode
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null

      • getChild

        public ASTNode getChild(int index)
        Return the child of this ASTNode given by the index.
        PRECONDITION: index is a non-null ASTNode.
        POSTCONDITION: this ASTNode, and its children, are unchanged.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the child of this ASTNode to return.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of children of this ASTNode.

      • arity

        public int arity()
        Return the number of children this ASTNode has.
        PRECONDITION: none
        POSTCONDITION: this ASTNode, and its children, are unchanged.
        Returns:
        the number of children this ASTNode has.

        public java.util.Iterator<ASTNode> iterator()

      • eval

        public abstract double eval(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> symtab)
        Evaluate the abstract syntax (sub)tree that is rooted at this ASTNode in the context of the given symbol table, and return the result.
        Parameters:
        symtab - A map from variable identifiers to values, to use as a symbol table in the evaluation.
        Returns:
        the double value that is the result of evaluating the abstract syntax (sub)tree rooted at this ASTNode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the abstract syntax (sub)tree rooted at this ASTNode cannot be evaluated.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - containing an appropriate message if a variable identifier in the AST rooted at this ASTNode is not properly initialized when evaluated.
